recipes.name: Caprese Salad
recipes.desc: A classic Italian salad showcasing the fresh flavors of tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil, drizzled with balsamic glaze.
instructions: Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on a serving platter.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between tomato and mozzarella slices.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Chicken Alfredo Pasta
recipes.desc: A comforting pasta dish featuring fettuccine tossed in a creamy Alfredo sauce made with garlic, Parmesan cheese, and optionally, grilled chicken.
instructions: Cook fettuccine pasta according to package instructions.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Stir in heavy cream and Parmesan cheese. Cook until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add sliced grilled chicken if desired.
Toss the cooked pasta in the Alfredo sauce and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Strawberry Shortcake
recipes.desc: A delightful dessert featuring sweetened strawberries sandwiched between layers of tender shortcake, topped with whipped cream.
ingredients: 1/2 cup unsalted butter, cold and cubed
instructions: In a bowl, toss sliced strawberries with sugar. Let sit for 15 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Cut in cold butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in milk and vanilla until just combined.
Drop spoonfuls of dough onto a baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown.
Slice the shortcakes in half, spoon strawberries over the bottom halves, top with whipped cream, and cover with the remaining shortcake halves.

recipes.name: Bruschetta
recipes.desc: A classic Italian appetizer featuring diced tomatoes, fresh basil, and garlic, drizzled with balsamic vinegar and olive oil on toasted baguette slices.
instructions: In a bowl, combine diced tomatoes, basil, garlic, balsamic vinegar, and olive oil.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Spoon the tomato mixture onto toasted baguette slices and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Vegetarian Stir-Fry
recipes.desc: A flavorful and colorful stir-fry featuring broccoli, bell peppers, carrots, and snap peas tossed in a savory soy and sesame sauce, served over brown rice.
instructions: In a wok or large skillet, heat sesame oil over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add broccoli, bell peppers, carrot, and snap peas. Stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Pour soy sauce over the vegetables and toss to combine.
Serve the stir-fry over cooked brown rice.

recipes.name: Lemon Bars
recipes.desc: Tangy and sweet lemon bars with a buttery crust, topped with a luscious lemon filling and dusted with powdered sugar.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9x9-inch baking pan.
In a medium bowl, combine flour, powdered sugar, and softened butter. Press into the bottom of the prepared pan.
Bake the crust for 15-20 minutes or until lightly golden.
In another bowl, whisk together eggs, granulated sugar, flour, baking powder, salt, lemon juice, and lemon zest.
Pour the lemon mixture over the baked crust and return to the oven for an additional 20-25 minutes, or until set.
Allow to cool completely before dusting with powdered sugar and cutting into bars.

recipes.name: Mushroom Risotto
recipes.desc: A creamy and flavorful risotto made with Arborio rice, mushrooms, Parmesan cheese, and a touch of white wine.
instructions: In a saucepan, heat the vegetable broth and keep it warm over low heat.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil and 1 tablespoon butter over medium heat. Add onions and garlic, sauté until softened.
Add Arborio rice to the skillet and stir to coat with oil. Cook for 2-3 minutes until the rice is lightly toasted.
Pour in the white wine and cook until it is mostly evaporated.
Begin adding warm vegetable broth, one ladle at a time, stirring frequently. Allow the liquid to be absorbed before adding the next ladle.
When the rice is almost tender, stir in the mushrooms. Continue adding broth and stirring until the rice is creamy and fully cooked.
Stir in Parmesan cheese and remaining butter. Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

recipes.name: Apple Pie
recipes.desc: A classic apple pie with a flaky crust, filled with sweet and spiced apple slices, and baked to golden perfection.
ingredients: 6 cups peeled, sliced apples (such as Granny Smith)
2 tablespoons unsalted butter, cut into small pieces
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
In a large bowl, combine sliced apples, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, lemon juice, and flour. Toss until the apples are evenly coated.
Roll out one pie crust and place it in a pie dish. Pour in the apple filling.
Roll out the second pie crust and place it over the filling. Trim and crimp the edges to seal the pie.
Cut slits in the top crust to allow steam to escape. Brush the crust with beaten egg for a golden finish.
Place small pieces of butter over the top of the pie.
Bake for 45-50 minutes or until the crust is golden and the filling is bubbly.
Allow to cool before slicing and serving.

recipes.name: Spinach and Artichoke Dip
recipes.desc: A creamy and cheesy dip with spinach and artichoke hearts, baked to perfection and served with tortilla chips or sliced baguette.
ingredients: 1 cup frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained
1 cup canned artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
Tortilla chips or sliced baguette for serving
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a mixing bowl, combine spinach, artichoke hearts, mayonnaise, sour cream, mozzarella, Parmesan, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and spread it evenly.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the dip is hot and bubbly.
Serve with tortilla chips or sliced baguette.

recipes.name: Shrimp Scampi
recipes.desc: A flavorful pasta dish with succulent shrimp, garlic, and a white wine and lemon sauce, served over linguine or spaghetti.
ingredients: 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook the pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat butter and olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and red pepper flakes, sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add shrimp to the skillet and cook until they turn pink, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Pour in white wine and lemon juice. Season with salt and black pepper. Simmer for 2-3 minutes.
Add cooked pasta to the skillet, tossing to coat in the sauce. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until heated through.
Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve with grated Parmesan cheese.
